= profession =

 field: integer '''.profession'''
 type: '''integer'''
 access: '''Read-only'''

== Syntax ==
 unit.profession

== Field Access ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Access !! Type !! Description
|-
| Read || integer || Returns the profession of the player character
|}

== Availability ==
This field is available on the following unit types:
* UNIT_ST_PC (Player Character)

== Description ==
The '''profession''' field contains the profession identifier for a player character. This field determines the character's class or career path and is commonly used to provide profession-specific equipment, abilities, or access to certain areas.

Common profession constants include:
* '''PROFESSION_CONJURER''' - Magic user specializing in conjuration spells
* '''PROFESSION_PRIEST''' - Religious character with healing and divine powers
* '''PROFESSION_FIGHTER''' - Combat specialist focused on melee weapons
* '''PROFESSION_THIEF''' - Stealthy character skilled in disarming and backstabbing
* '''PROFESSION_ASSASSIN''' - Specialized killer with advanced stealth techniques
* '''PROFESSION_RANGER''' - Wilderness expert with nature and tracking skills
* '''PROFESSION_SORCERER''' - Magic user specializing in offensive spells
* '''PROFESSION_PALADIN''' - Holy warrior with divine combat abilities
* '''PROFESSION_NECROMANCER''' - Dark magic user specializing in death and undead
* '''PROFESSION_DRUID''' - Nature-based magic user with shapeshifting abilities
* '''PROFESSION_KNIGHT''' - Armored warrior with chivalric combat skills
* '''PROFESSION_BARBARIAN''' - Fierce warrior from tribal backgrounds

== Examples ==
 dilbegin profession_equipment();
 var
    prof : integer;
 code
 {
    prof := self.profession;
    
    if (prof == PROFESSION_FIGHTER)
    {
       sendtext("You are a mighty fighter! Here's your sword and shield.<br/>", self);
    }
    else if (prof == PROFESSION_MAGE)
    {
       sendtext("You are a wise mage! Here's your spellbook and staff.<br/>", self);
    }
    else if (prof == PROFESSION_CLERIC)
    {
       sendtext("You are a devout cleric! Here's your holy symbol and mace.<br/>", self);
    }
    else
    {
       sendtext("Your profession is: " + itoa(prof) + "<br/>", self);
    }
    
    quit;
 } dilend

 dilbegin profession_greeting();
 var
    player_prof : integer;
 code
 {
    player_prof := activator.profession;
    
    if (player_prof == PROFESSION_THIEF)
    {
       act("Welcome back, shadow walker! The shadows await your skills.", 
          A_ALWAYS, self, null, activator, TO_CHAR);
    }
    else if (player_prof == PROFESSION_PALADIN)
    {
       act("Greetings, noble warrior! May justice guide your blade.", 
          A_ALWAYS, self, null, activator, TO_CHAR);
    }
    else if (player_prof == PROFESSION_RANGER)
    {
       act("Hail, guardian of the wild! Nature calls to you.", 
          A_ALWAYS, self, null, activator, TO_CHAR);
    }
    else if (player_prof == PROFESSION_DRUID)
    {
       act("Blessings, child of nature! The forest sings your name.", 
          A_ALWAYS, self, null, activator, TO_CHAR);
    }
    else
    {
       act("Welcome, adventurer! May your path be true.", 
          A_ALWAYS, self, null, activator, TO_CHAR);
    }
    
    quit;
 } dilend

 dilbegin profession_restriction();
 var
    target_prof : integer;
 code
 {
    target_prof := target.profession;
    
    // Check if target can enter restricted area
    if (target_prof == PROFESSION_NECROMANCER)
    {
       act("The holy grounds reject your dark presence, necromancer!", 
          A_ALWAYS, self, null, target, TO_VICT);
       act("$1n blocks $3n from entering the sacred area.", 
          A_ALWAYS, self, null, target, TO_ROOM);
    }
    else if (target_prof == PROFESSION_ASSASSIN)
    {
       act("The guards recognize you as an assassin and deny entry!", 
          A_ALWAYS, self, null, target, TO_VICT);
       act("$1n prevents $3n from entering the city.", 
          A_ALWAYS, self, null, target, TO_ROOM);
    }
    else
    {
       act("Welcome, traveler! The city gates open for you.", 
          A_ALWAYS, self, null, target, TO_VICT);
    }
    
    quit;
 } dilend

 dilbegin profession_bonus();
 var
    prof : integer;
 code
 {
    prof := self.profession;
    
    // Give profession-specific bonuses
    if (prof == PROFESSION_FIGHTER)
    {
       self.abilities[ABIL_STR] := self.abilities[ABIL_STR] + 5;
       sendtext("Your fighting spirit enhances your strength!<br/>", self);
    }
    else if (prof == PROFESSION_MAGE)
    {
       self.abilities[ABIL_MAG] := self.abilities[ABIL_MAG] + 5;
       sendtext("Your magical focus enhances your power!<br/>", self);
    }
    else if (prof == PROFESSION_CLERIC)
    {
       self.abilities[ABIL_DIV] := self.abilities[ABIL_DIV] + 5;
       sendtext("Your faith enhances your divine power!<br/>", self);
    }
    
    quit;
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The profession field is read-only and cannot be modified by DIL code
* Profession is typically set during character creation or through special commands
* The field is only available on player characters (UNIT_ST_PC)
* Profession constants are defined in values.h and/or vme.h with PROFESSION_ prefix
* This field is commonly used for profession-specific equipment distribution and area restrictions

== Error Handling ==
The field access will return '''fail''' when:
* Attempting to access profession on a non-player character unit
* The unit is null or invalid
* The zone has insufficient access level to read profession information
